main.name: Jacqueline Moore
main.description: a writer, a photographer, and a climber.
main.bio: I'm Jacqueline, and I'm a third-year undergraduate student at the University of California, Davis. I plan to graduate in December of 2021 with two degrees: a B.S. in biomedical engineering and a B.A. in English.
main.listIntro: I built this website because there's more to me than what's on my resume. Let's get started with a list of need-to-know facts about me:
bioList: My favorite podcast is called 'No Such Thing As A Fish.'
One of my personal goals is to climb Half Dome in Yosemite.
Another goal is to bake the perfect loaf of banana bread. (It's harder than you think.)
If I had to name my favorite book, I'd say Ian McEwan's 'Atonement.'
My least favorite book is 'The Catcher in the Rye.'
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

resume.skillmessage: Here you can create a short write-up of your skills to show off to employers

education.description: Upper Division Coursework: Engineering Problem Solving with MATLAB, Statistics in Biomedical Engineering, Biomedical Engineering Special Study (Research), Human Physiology, British Romantic Literature.

work.title: Technical Writing Intern — Einstein Analytics
work.description: Built out the Einstein Analytics Learning Adventure App, an interactive program that teaches customers how to use Einstein Analytics (Salesforce's data analysis software). Wrote content for the app that introduces specific features to users, and also created in-app, interactive use cases based on sample datasets.

work.title: Technical Writing Intern
work.description: Collaborated with software engineering interns to write a user manual for a new bulk scripting feature. Additionally revised technical manuals about newly-released features. Wrote copy for email campaigns about company updates and new features for users.

work.title: Marketing Intern
work.description: Launched client interview protocol for community outreach project. Conducted interviews of clients, then wrote personal profiles about interviewees. Also designed and wrote content for digital pamphlets to publicize company events.

work.company: The Arthur Morgan Institute for Community Solutions
work.title: Research Intern

activities.title: Microfluidics Team Lead
activities.description: Leading an 8-person research team in constructing two cost-efficient microfluidic controllers for RNA sequencing. Also collaborating with teammates to design and build microfluidic chips using AutoCAD and UV exposure systems (for low-cost photolithography).

activities.title: Vice President of Outreach and Content Strategy
activities.description: Building company website (bigucd.com) by writing new content, creating webpages, and developing site navigation structure. Composing monthly newsletters detailing the progress of research teams as well as updates about interns and student lab managers.

activities.title: Copy Editor
activities.description: Proofreading copy — roughly 25 articles per week — using The Aggie's variation of the AP Style Guide. Previously served the paper as a campus news reporter, which involved composing one article per week and conducting relevant, in-person interviews.

activities.title: Microfluidics Researcher
activities.info: Collaborated with teammates to work on the Real Vegan Cheese project (synthesizing casein proteins to develop vegan cheese), then shifted to join the Microfluidics team.

projects.title: MANUAL: Guide to building tables with Einstein Analytics (not yet deployed)
COPY: remote.it email update for new feature
LAB REPORT: RFP Expression in Plasmids

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
